data:
Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

Hi Myrcella,

 

I found two apartments you may be interested. Both of them are under $700 one bedroom apartment.

Here are the links:

https://corvallis.craigslist.org/apa/5748045905.html

https://corvallis.craigslist.org/apa/5772420484.html

 

Elizabeth

 

From: Myrcella Baratheon [mailto:myrcella.baratheon@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 2:01 PM
To: Eveland, Elizabeth <Elizabeth.Eveland@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Housing... OMG!

 

Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

Hi!
 
There’s a picnic in the woods near Alsea that we’re supposed to go to this weekend. We may also hike to the waterfall. Can you please check the weather and let me know what I should wear and if I should bring sunscreen?
 
Thank you, 
 
Myrcella

Hi Myrcella,

 

The weather at Alsea is going to be sunny and the temperature will be around 64-73. I think you should bring a jacket or wear long sleeve. But also bring some sunscreen with you.

Have fun hiking!

 

Eve

 

From: Myrcella Baratheon [mailto:myrcella.baratheon@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 2:08 PM
To: Eveland, Elizabeth <Elizabeth.Eveland@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Weather?

 

 

Hi!

 

There’s a picnic in the woods near Alsea that we’re supposed to go to this weekend. We may also hike to the waterfall. Can you please check the weather and let me know what I should wear and if I should bring sunscreen?

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Eve,




Thanks!




Myrcella



On 09/10/2016 02:10 PM, Eveland, Elizabeth wrote:


	Hi Myrcella,

	 

	The weather at Alsea is going to be sunny and the temperature will be around 64-73. I think you should bring a jacket or wear long sleeve. But also bring some sunscreen with you.

	Have fun hiking!

	 

	Eve

	 

	From: Myrcella Baratheon [mailto:myrcella.baratheon@oregonstate.edu] 
	Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 2:08 PM
	To: Eveland, Elizabeth <Elizabeth.Eveland@oregonstate.edu> <mailto:Elizabeth.Eveland@oregonstate.edu> 
	Subject:  Weather?

	 

	 

	Hi!

	 

	There’s a picnic in the woods near Alsea that we’re supposed to go to this weekend. We may also hike to the waterfall. Can you please check the weather and let me know what I should wear and if I should bring sunscreen?

	 

	Thank you, 

	 

	Myrcella

Hello Elizabeth,
 
I am planning an event at my sorority this weekend and I could use some ideas for food to make as appetizers. I am expecting to have 20 people at the event and would like to include options for those who are vegetarian or gluten free. I will have about an hour to make these ahead of time so please keep that in mind as you research. It’s really important that people love the event, so try and pick some recipes that people will rave about!
 
Please email me three or four recipes that I can consider for appetizers.  
 
Thank you, 
 
Myrcella

Hi Myrcella,

 

Here are some recipes for you which are great for vegetarian and are gluten free.

Easy Guacamole: http://allrecipes.com/recipe/14064/easy-guacamole/?internalSource=staff%20pick&referringId=1697&referringContentType=recipe%20hub&clickId=cardslot%203

Chocolate Chip Cheese Ball: http://allrecipes.com/recipe/26740/chocolate-chip-cheese-ball/?internalSource=hub%20recipe&referringId=1697&referringContentType=recipe%20hub&clickId=cardslot%2014

Ceil's Cucumber Slices: http://allrecipes.com/recipe/20548/ceils-cucumber-slices/?internalSource=recipe%20hub&referringId=1697&referringContentType=recipe%20hub&clickId=cardslot%2053

 

Have fun!

Eve

From: Myrcella Baratheon [mailto:myrcella.baratheon@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 2:12 PM
To: Eveland, Elizabeth <Elizabeth.Eveland@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Awesome recipes

 

 

Hello Elizabeth,

 

I am planning an event at my sorority this weekend and I could use some ideas for food to make as appetizers. I am expecting to have 20 people at the event and would like to include options for those who are vegetarian or gluten free. I will have about an hour to make these ahead of time so please keep that in mind as you research. It’s really important that people love the event, so try and pick some recipes that people will rave about!

 

Please email me three or four recipes that I can consider for appetizers.  

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Eve,




I'm definitely making those cheese balls :)




Myrcella

	Hi Myrcella,

	 

	Here are some recipes for you which are great for vegetarian and are gluten free.

	Easy Guacamole: http://allrecipes.com/recipe/14064/easy-guacamole/?internalSource=staff%20pick&referringId=1697&referringContentType=recipe%20hub&clickId=cardslot%203

	Chocolate Chip Cheese Ball: http://allrecipes.com/recipe/26740/chocolate-chip-cheese-ball/?internalSource=hub%20recipe&referringId=1697&referringContentType=recipe%20hub&clickId=cardslot%2014

	Ceil's Cucumber Slices: http://allrecipes.com/recipe/20548/ceils-cucumber-slices/?internalSource=recipe%20hub&referringId=1697&referringContentType=recipe%20hub&clickId=cardslot%2053

	 

	Have fun!

	Eve

	From: Myrcella Baratheon [mailto:myrcella.baratheon@oregonstate.edu] 
	Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 2:12 PM
	To: Eveland, Elizabeth <Elizabeth.Eveland@oregonstate.edu> <mailto:Elizabeth.Eveland@oregonstate.edu> 
	Subject:  Awesome recipes

	 

	 

	Hello Elizabeth,

	 

	I am planning an event at my sorority this weekend and I could use some ideas for food to make as appetizers. I am expecting to have 20 people at the event and would like to include options for those who are vegetarian or gluten free. I will have about an hour to make these ahead of time so please keep that in mind as you research. It’s really important that people love the event, so try and pick some recipes that people will rave about!

	 

	Please email me three or four recipes that I can consider for appetizers.  

	 

	Thank you, 

	 

	Myrcella

Hello Elizabeth,
 
Just a friendly reminder that I’ll need the following two books soon and you promised to help me buy them for a good price!
 
Please find them wherever you can, just make sure you will receive them by next week for classes. My budget is at most 200 dollars to get these two textbooks, but please please please try and find the best available prices.
 
Textbooks Needed:
Engineering Economic Analysis by Donald Newnan 12th edition IBSN: 978-0199339273
 
Robert Love, Linux Kernel Development 3/e, Addison-Wesley, 2010, ISBN: 978-1-672-32946-3
 
Email me back with where to buy them for the best price so they’ll arrive next week! I owe you lunch for this big help!
 
Thanks!
Myrcella

Hi Myrcells,

 

I found amazon offers the best deal and you can save your money by purchasing used books.

Here are the links:

https://www.amazon.com/Engineering-Economic-Analysis-Donald-Newnan/dp/0199339279/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1473542432&sr=8-1&keywords=9780199339273

https://www.amazon.com/Linux-Kernel-Development-Robert-Love/dp/0672329468/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1473542552&sr=8-1&keywords=%2C+Linux+Kernel+Development+3%2Fe

 

Also, you can select express shipping and your book will arrive by next week.

 

Eve

 

From: Myrcella Baratheon [mailto:myrcella.baratheon@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 2:20 PM
To: Eveland, Elizabeth <Elizabeth.Eveland@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Textbook help reminder!

 

Hello Elizabeth,

 

Just a friendly reminder that I’ll need the following two books soon and you promised to help me buy them for a good price!

 

Please find them wherever you can, just make sure you will receive them by next week for classes. My budget is at most 200 dollars to get these two textbooks, but please please please try and find the best available prices.

 

Textbooks Needed:

Engineering Economic Analysis by Donald Newnan 12th edition IBSN: 978-0199339273

 

Robert Love, Linux Kernel Development 3/e, Addison-Wesley, 2010, ISBN: 978-1-672-32946-3

 

Email me back with where to buy them for the best price so they’ll arrive next week! I owe you lunch for this big help!

 

Thanks!

Myrcella

Hi, Elizabeth ,
 
Game of Thrones season six is over and I really need something new to watch! I just don’t know what would be good. 
 
I’m a big fan of action dramas such as House of Cards and Homeland (all of which I’ve already seen, unfortunately). 
 
What’s the next best show after these three? I don’t want to be fooled into watching something bad, so please see if the critics agree that the show is really excellent. Some rankings would also help give me confidence the show will be worthwhile.
 
Thank you so much! 

Melisandre

Hi Melisandre,

 

I’m a fan of Game of Thrones too. I would suggest you to watch Viking. This tv show is awesome and has lots of action in it.

Here are the links with rankings.

https://www.rottentomatoes.com/tv/vikings_2013/

http://www.tv.com/shows/vikings/

 

Enjoy!

Eve

From: Lannister, Melisandre [mailto:Melisandre.Lannister@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 3:37 PM
To: Eveland, Elizabeth <Elizabeth.Eveland@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Best TV Show to Watch

 

Hi, Elizabeth ,

 

Game of Thrones season six is over and I really need something new to watch! I just don’t know what would be good. 

 

I’m a big fan of action dramas such as House of Cards and Homeland (all of which I’ve already seen, unfortunately). 

 

What’s the next best show after these three? I don’t want to be fooled into watching something bad, so please see if the critics agree that the show is really excellent. Some rankings would also help give me confidence the show will be worthwhile.

 

Thank you so much! 


Melisandre

Sweet! I'll watch that.

Melisandre

	Hi Melisandre,

	 

	I’m a fan of Game of Thrones too. I would suggest you to watch Viking. This tv show is awesome and has lots of action in it.

	Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 3:37 PM
	To: Eveland, Elizabeth <Elizabeth.Eveland@oregonstate.edu> <mailto:Elizabeth.Eveland@oregonstate.edu> 
	Subject:  Best TV Show to Watch

	 

	Hi, Elizabeth ,

	 

	Game of Thrones season six is over and I really need something new to watch! I just don’t know what would be good. 

	 

	I’m a big fan of action dramas such as House of Cards and Homeland (all of which I’ve already seen, unfortunately). 

	 

	What’s the next best show after these three? I don’t want to be fooled into watching something bad, so please see if the critics agree that the show is really excellent. Some rankings would also help give me confidence the show will be worthwhile.

	 

	Thank you so much! 

	
	Melisandre

Hi there!
 
I need to buy a gift for a friend.
 
My friend loves the outdoors and the color pink.
She’s 22 years old and her birthday is in a week (7 days).
I will need something that will get here on time.
Nothing that will take too long to ship please.
 
I have 30 dollars to spend on my friend.
Please spend as close to that as you can.
 
Please email me the link(s) to the gift(s) you find and include how much they cost.
 
Thank you,
Melisandre

Hi Melisandre,

 

I have found a pink Foldable Silicone Bottle on amazon. This bottle is great for camping and outdoor activities. It’s cost only $9 and it will arrive within 7 days. I’m sure she will like it.

Here is the link: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01GJPPBQW?ref_=ams_ad_dp_asin_2

 

Eve

 

From: Lannister, Melisandre [mailto:Melisandre.Lannister@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 3:49 PM
To: Eveland, Elizabeth <Elizabeth.Eveland@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Find a Gift for Someone

 

Hi there!

 

I need to buy a gift for a friend.

 

My friend loves the outdoors and the color pink.

She’s 22 years old and her birthday is in a week (7 days).

I will need something that will get here on time.

Nothing that will take too long to ship please.

 

I have 30 dollars to spend on my friend.

Please spend as close to that as you can.

 

Please email me the link(s) to the gift(s) you find and include how much they cost.

 

Thank you,

Melisandre

Hi there,

 

I heard from a friend that you are the one to talk to about this subject.

 

Unfortunately, my friend has to take two strong medications together - Adderall, and Valium. Are there any issues (contraindications) with taking them both together? Is there anything (food, activities, etc.) that he needs to avoid? I just want him to be safe. Please send a list of what you find, along with links to your resources.

 

Thanks for volunteering to check it out!

 

Davos

Hi Davos,

 

According to Drugs.com, there is no drug interaction between Adderall and Valium. However, this does not necessarily mean no interactions exist. Always consult with your doctor or pharmacist. Here is the link: https://www.drugs.com/drug-interactions/adderall-with-valium-190-1645-862-441.html

 

Here is a list of information I found for Adderall,

Follow all directions on your prescription label. Your doctor may occasionally change your dose to make sure you get the best results. Do not take this medicine in larger or smaller amounts or for longer than recommended.

Adderall may be habit-forming. Never share this medicine with another person, especially someone with a history of drug abuse or addiction. Selling or giving away this medicine is against the law.

You may take this medicine with or without food. It is best to take Adderall first thing in the morning.

Do not crush, chew, break, or open an Adderall XR extended-release capsule. Swallow it whole.

To make swallowing easier, you may open the capsule and sprinkle the medicine into a spoonful of applesauce. Swallow right away without chewing. Do not save the mixture for later use.

While using Adderall, your doctor will need to check your progress at regular visits. Your heart rate, blood pressure, height and weight may also need to be checked often.

Adderall can cause unusual results with certain medical tests. Tell any doctor who treats you that you are using this medicine.

Store at room temperature away from moisture, heat, and light.

Keep track of the amount of medicine used from each new bottle. Adderall is a drug of abuse and you should be aware if anyone is using your medicine improperly or without a prescription.

For more information, please go to this link: https://www.drugs.com/adderall.html

 

For Valium,

Take Valium exactly as prescribed by your doctor. Follow all directions on your prescription label. Your doctor may occasionally change your dose to make sure you get the best results. Do not take this medicine in larger or smaller amounts or for longer than recommended.

Valium may be habit-forming. Misuse of habit-forming medicine can cause addiction, overdose, or death. Selling or giving away this medicine is against the law.

Measure liquid medicine with the dosing syringe provided, or with a special dose-measuring spoon or medicine cup. If you do not have a dose-measuring device, ask your pharmacist for one.

Valium should be used for only a short time. Do not take this medicine for longer than 4 months without your doctor's advice.

Do not stop using Valium suddenly, or you could have increased seizures or unpleasant withdrawal symptoms. Ask your doctor how to safely stop using diazepam.

Call your doctor at once if you feel that this medicine is not working as well as usual, or if you think you need to use more than usual.

While using Valium, you may need frequent blood tests at your doctor's office.

Store at room temperature away from moisture, heat, and light. After you have stopped using this medicine, flush any unused pills down the toilet.

Keep track of the amount of medicine used from each new bottle. Valium is a drug of abuse and you should be aware if anyone is using your medicine improperly or without a prescription.

https://www.drugs.com/valium.html

 

From: Stark, Davos 
Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 4:17 PM
To: Eveland, Elizabeth <Elizabeth.Eveland@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  check on medication

 

Hi there,

 

I heard from a friend that you are the one to talk to about this subject.

 

Unfortunately, my friend has to take two strong medications together - Adderall, and Valium. Are there any issues (contraindications) with taking them both together? Is there anything (food, activities, etc.) that he needs to avoid? I just want him to be safe. Please send a list of what you find, along with links to your resources.

 

Thanks for volunteering to check it out!

 

Davos

Thank you, Eve. You really know a lot about drugs! I’m glad I was able to reach you! It sounds like my friend has to be careful with these drugs. Maybe I can get him to talk to his doctor right away.

 

Thanks again for your help!

 

Davos

Hello Elizabeth,

 

I know graduating is coming up soon for you. It would be good to do a preliminary job search. Please find at least 1 job and send me an email with the link(s) to the job(s) you applied for. 

 

 

Here is the link for one job search site to get started. 

 

http://www.indeed.com 

 

Job criteria: 

 

You should find a computer engineering job. 

 

Must start after September 2016.

 

For now, just find one or more jobs you believe will work out well. We can talk about them further at our next meeting.

 

Sincerely, 

 

Davos

Hi Davos,

 

I found few computer engineering jobs and I have applied them.

Here are the links to the jobs.

http://jobs.intel.com/ShowJob/Id/930693/Software%20Engineer

https://jobs-standard.icims.com/jobs/15184/software-engineer-i/job?mode=job&iis=Indeed&iisn=Indeed.com&aasi=2&mobile=false&width=670&height=500&bga=true&needsRedirect=false&jan1offset=-480&jun1offset=-420

 

Thanks,

Eve

Looks like some good jobs, especially Intel. I think you are on the right track, especially if you can find some life science application areas. Let me know how the interviews go.

 

Davos

Hello Elizabeth, 
 
I am your academic advisor. 
 
Below is a list of classes you must enroll in for Fall Term 2016 (yes, it’s actually still summer right now): 
 
ST 314 
PAC 201 
WR 121 
COMM 111 
H 100 
Note** Do not worry if there is no space in the class. I will make sure you get a spot in the class. 
 
In order to view the available times for these classes please use the OSU catalog <http://catalog.oregonstate.edu/Default.aspx?section=Course> . 
 
Please provide me with a list of the CRNs so that I can finish your registration process. 
Once you have been registered, I will provide you with the list of textbooks you will need for your classes. Since the textbook selection will be shared, we require all textbooks be acquired legally. 
 
Thank you, 
Professor Targaryen

Dear Professor Targaryen,

 

Thank you for your help. Here are the CRNs for these classes.

 

ST 314: 20855

PAC 201: 10050

WR 121: 10098

COMM 111: 13520, Recitation: 15519

H 100: 15217

 

Thank you very much,

Eve

 

From: Arya Targaryen [mailto:arya.targaryen@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 2:26 PM
To: Eveland, Elizabeth <Elizabeth.Eveland@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Create an Ideal Class Schedule

Thank you, 

Professor Targaryen

Greetings, traveler,

 

I hear you’re are interested in exploring Eastern Europe with our group. Recently the group is wondering whether or not it is safe to travel right now. We need to do some research and see what we can find out.

 

The plan is to land in Istanbul. Next, we will be traveling to Sofia, the capital of Bulgaria.  After Sofia, the next step is some car travel to Macedonia and then onwards to Albania. Our last stop will be Tirana, in Albania.

 

The group would like to have some information sent to me to start this travel planning out:

 

A quick overview of each country’s political climate - I don’t want anyone getting into trouble and having this turn into some geopolitical affair! Is the country at war with a US ally? Is the country in political turmoil? Is there a US embassy? Is it safe to travel there now?

 

This will be a good start for the travel planning. Please research these items and send the information to me right away.

 

Kind regards,

Davos Stark

Eastern Reaches, an OSU Travel Group

Hi Davos,

 

First of all, I don’t think it’s safe to land at Istanbul. There was an explosion at Istanbul airport three days ago. According to The Telegraph, there is a heightened risk of terrorist attack against the aviation industry in Turkey.

 

Second, there is a US embassy at Sofia. Here is the details: 

U.S. Embassy Sofia

16, Kozyak Street

Sofia 1408, Bulgaria

Telephone: +(359) (2) 937-5100

It’s pretty safe to travel at Sofia. You should be aware of the local security situation.

 

Third,

Here is the information of US embassy at Macedonia.

U.S. Embassy Skopje

Samoilova21

1000 Skopje

Republic of Macedonia

Telephone: +(389) (2) 310-2000

Emergency After-Hours Telephone: +(389) (2) 310-2000

According to the US website about Macedonia , violent crime against U.S. citizens is rare. Theft and other petty street crimes do occur, particularly in areas where tourists and foreigners congregate.

 

Fourth, here is the information of US embassy at Tirana.

 

U.S. Embassy Tirana

Rr. Elbasanit, No. 103

Tirana, Albania

Telephone: +(355) (0) 4224-7285

Emergency After-Hours Telephone: +(355) (0) 4224-7285

I don’t think it’s a good idea to travel Tirana. Credible information indicates terrorist groups continue plotting possible attacks in Europe.  European governments are taking action to guard against terrorist attacks; however, all European countries remain potentially vulnerable to attacks from transnational terrorist organizations.

 

I hope this is helpful for your trip.

 

Eve

 

From: Stark, Davos 
Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 4:00 PM
To: Eveland, Elizabeth <Elizabeth.Eveland@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  travel planning

 

Greetings, traveler,

 

I hear you’re are interested in exploring Eastern Europe with our group. Recently the group is wondering whether or not it is safe to travel right now. We need to do some research and see what we can find out.

 

The plan is to land in Istanbul. Next, we will be traveling to Sofia, the capital of Bulgaria.  After Sofia, the next step is some car travel to Macedonia and then onwards to Albania. Our last stop will be Tirana, in Albania.

 

The group would like to have some information sent to me to start this travel planning out:

 

A quick overview of each country’s political climate - I don’t want anyone getting into trouble and having this turn into some geopolitical affair! Is the country at war with a US ally? Is the country in political turmoil? Is there a US embassy? Is it safe to travel there now?

 

This will be a good start for the travel planning. Please research these items and send the information to me right away.

 

Kind regards,

Davos Stark

Eastern Reaches, an OSU Travel Group

Hi Eve,

 

This is some great information! Parts of our trip may be safe, but others we have to reconsider. Thank you so much for digging up all of this. I’m sure the travel group will appreciate it. Hopefully we can talk about all of these issues at our next meeting.

 

Best,

Davos
